snippet: Stanford's defeat in the Fiesta Bowl evoked memories of the school's indelible loss to Cal in 1982.
abstract: Stanford's defeat in the Fiesta Bowl evoked memories of the school's indelible loss to Cal in 1982.
lead_paragraph: There are many ways to lose a football game, but you would be hard-pressed to find one as heart-wrenching as the way Stanford lost to Oklahoma State in the Fiesta Bowl on Monday night. The Cardinal did not trail until the final whistle, had six different 7-point leads in the game, had the ball for 70 percent of the clock and outgained the Cowboys by 178 total yards, including a 243-13 advantage on the ground. Yet still Stanford could not come away with the win.

headline.main: In Stanford Loss, Echoes of Elway
